intro: Sagittanthera, commonly known as the arrowhead plant, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its distinctive arrow-shaped leaves, which give it its common name. The flowers are typically yellow or orange and are arranged in a composite head, typical of the Asteraceae family. Sagittanthera species are native to various regions in the Americas, particularly in tropical and subtropical areas. These plants are often grown as ornamental plants due to their attractive foliage and vibrant blooms.
